author: ChickenMan
title: For great playability and pieces!
review:
This 2016 Creator set caught my eye for the chance to pick up some interesting looking pieces in unusual colours, and because all three of the builds looked fun.

Box/Instructions

Box art shows all 3 of the “official” buildable models on the front and back as well as the usual parts inventory.  Inside are three separate instruction booklets, one for each of the alternate builds, and 2 clear bags full of pieces.

Parts

124 pieces. Some of the rarer pieces you get in this set include 6047426 Dark Green Plate with Bow, and 2 of the 6101285 “Earth Green” 2x2 plate with bow which has only every appeared in 8 sets. You also get 2 of the Dark Green 6134974  Mud Guards, a piece that seems rare as no image exists for it on Briskset and Bricklink is currently listing it as “New”.  For vehicle building it’s always useful to have  6066119, which you get here in Dark Stone Grey. Paying about 8p per piece is very reasonable given the variety of pieces included. It was also nice to get 2 of the 4225532 1x1 brick with handle and the smooth transparent red flat tiles. For parts, this is an awesome set. No stickers included

Minifigures

No minifigures are included and none of the vehicles are really to minifigure scale

The build

The “Chopper Transporter” truck, although a quick build as you’d expect from a set of this size,  features a lot of detailing on the truck that they didn’t have to put on, but they did; and in this respect it’s a very pleasing build. The other two variants are very quick, 3-4 minutes each and much simpler.

The completed model

The “Chopper Transporter”, the main build, is assembled in two sections, with the orange / white helicopter first. This is a great little model, realistically proportioned and with some great detail given its tiny size. The transporter truck is really nicely done, too, with some great detailing using a lot of small pieces and a really nicely shaped and proportioned cab. The chopper clips onto the flat bed at the rear by means of a 6126082 2x2 plate.

The tractor is a quicker build and looks good.  Despite all 4 wheels bring the same size on this tractor, the likeness is good and the detailing nice. It has a detachable plough or some kind of agricultural device that can be clipped on to the rear. Overall in looks it resembles a beefed up 30284. 

The "off-roader" is a neat little jeep-type-thing that sort-of resembles, and would be a good competitor for, 31040 Desert Racer and 30283 from 2015's Creator range. Perhaps these jeep/buggy builds are Lego's go-to idea when trying to work out what to do for build number 3 of these Creator sets! Still it looks very nice and you can probably even drive it from race to race on the back of 31033, if you have it. It's compact and tidy and does the job very well.

Overall opinion

Sometimes these 3 in 1 Creator sets feature a great primary build and then the other two tail off in quality. This is not one of these sets. All three models offer great looks and playability, and have really nice details. The instructions promote a combination with 2016 Creator sets 31040 (to race against the off-roader), and 31041 (to be transported on the truck). The art on the instructions also shows the deck crane from the 31045 set mounted on the back of the Transporter truck and lifting the “mini sub” out of the water, whilst the helicopter from this set lands on the ship’s deck.

So; lots of play opportunities. For me, though, the real winning factor from this set is the pieces – 124 pieces, with a wide variety,  quite a few pretty rare ones in rare colours, for under a tenner - it's a great bargain.
